business.headline: Defence personnel get specialised home loan options. Details hereAs competition rises and metro demand cools, housing finance firms are recalibrating strategies, betting on defence families as low-risk, long-term borrowers who need customised loans rather than generic salaried products.

PAN–Aadhaar not linked after December 31? Be ready for penalty and ITR issuesThe December 31 PAN–Aadhaar linking deadline is crucial for taxpayers, as missing it may lead to penalties, ITR filing restrictions, refund delays and higher tax deductions at source.

Sensex, Nifty end lower as year-end rally fizzlesThe BSE Sensex closed at 85,041.45, down 367.25 points or 0.43%, while the NSE Nifty50 settled at 26,042.30, lower by 99.80 points. The session remained volatile, with markets slipping after early stability as investors turned cautious at higher levels.

Is India's housing market entering a new phase of lower sales but higher value?Even though the number of homes sold declined, the overall value of housing sales increased by 6% year-on-year. The total sales value crossed Rs 6 lakh crore in 2025, up from about Rs 5.68 lakh crore in the previous year, mentioned report.

Explained: Why copper prices have hit a record highThe rally is not the result of a single trigger. Instead, it reflects a powerful mix of rising demand, tight supply and supportive global conditions that have reshaped the copper market.

Why are Swiggy, Zomato and Amazon gig workers going on strike on December 31?The strike has been announced by the Telangana Gig and Platform Workers Union along with the Indian Federation of App-Based Transport Workers.

Wonder drug for male baldness puts Swiss firm Cosmo's shares on steroidsStrong trial data has rewritten Cosmo's prospects, but the real test lies ahead as regulators, partners and patients decide whether this promising science can truly deliver commercial success globally eventually.

Sensex tumbles over 400 points: Why is the stock market down today?At 1:02 pm, the BSE Sensex was down 386.20 points to 85,022.50, while the NSE Nifty50 fell 106.80 points to trade at 26,035.30. Most of the broader market indices were also trading in negative territory as volatility rose during the session.

Hindustan Copper shares at 15-year high: What's driving the rallyThe stock has been one of the standout performers in the metal space, and Friday's move reflects a mix of strong commodity trends and sustained investor interest.

Made a mistake in your ITR? Here's how many times you can still revise itIf you think filing your income tax return locks everything in, that is not entirely true. The tax department recognises that genuine mistakes can happen and allows taxpayers to revise their returns, provided they act within the allowed time window.

How will insurance industry trends create new opportunities in 2026?Powered by artificial intelligence, rising climate risks, and changing customer expectations, the insurance industry is now silently transforming itself. Some of the trends that we may see in 2026 could look very different from what most people expect today.

Gold, silver extend record rally: Should you buy now?With gold anchoring portfolios and silver leading returns, should investors keep adding exposure, or step back and wait as record prices test discipline and long-term allocation strategies?

Is India's real estate market entering a more mature and institutional phase?Forces such as digitisation, institutional capital and changing consumer preferences reshaped the sector. More than just building structures, real estate is now about creating ecosystems that are interoperable with transit, logistics, digital infrastructure and services.

What happens if you do not file a revised ITR after your refund is put on holdWhen a return is flagged under the risk management framework, the refund does not move forward on its own. If a taxpayer does not revise the return or respond to the issue flagged, the refund can remain on hold indefinitely, even if the claim is otherwise genuine.

RVNL share price zooms over 11% today. What investors need to knowAt around 10:32 am, the RVNL share price was trading 11.01% higher at Rs 383.75 on the BSE, making it one of the top-performing public sector stocks during the session.

IRFC shares jump over 7% today. Here's what's driving the rallyAt around 10:32 am, IRFC shares were trading 7.42% higher on the BSE at Rs 130.50, emerging as one of the top gainers among public sector stocks during the session.

RVNL, IRFC, IRCTC: Why are these railway stocks rising today?At around 9:55 am, IRCTC was up 1.35% at Rs 688.85 on the BSE, while Rail Vikas Nigam Limited surged 8.94% to Rs 376.60. Indian Railway Finance Corporation also saw strong buying, rising 6.07% to Rs 128.87.

Eggs on the boil: Why prices are high and when they might coolEgg prices reflect a market resetting after years of strain, where higher costs, cautious supply, and steady demand mean consumers should expect easing, not a return to cheap eggs soon.

Why Dalal Street's Santa rally failed to take off this yearWhat began as a tentative Santa rally faded quietly, leaving benchmark indices range-bound and investors asking why seasonal cheer failed to translate into sustained gains. Read on to find out what it means for Dalal Street investors.

Sensex, Nifty slip at open as Dalal Street rally loses momentumAt around 9:18 am, the S&P BSE Sensex was down 95.26 points at 85,313.44, while the NSE Nifty50 slipped 40.80 points to trade at 26,101.30. Broader markets also traded in the red, with volatility ticking up during early trade.

entertainment.headline: Anasuya Bharadwaj calls out age-shaming after Sivaji comments spark backlash Actor Anasuya Bharadwaj responded to age-shaming trolls after her online criticism of actor Sivaji's sexist remarks during a recent promotional event.

Drishyam 3 update: Jaideep Ahlawat joins Ajay Devgn and Tabu The much-anticipated third instalment of the Drishyam franchise will feature Jaideep Ahlawat joining Ajay Devgn and Tabu, with filming set to start in January 2026. The movie continues the story of Vijay Salgaonkar, played by Devgn, and introduces new twists to the established storyline.

After Dhurandhar impacts its run, Kis Kisko Pyaar Karoon 2 eyes January re-release The comedy sequel Kis Kisko Pyaar Karoon 2, starring Kapil Sharma, is set for a re-release in January 2026 after its initial run was affected by competition from Dhurandhar. The producers hope to bring the film back to wider audiences following limited screen availability during its original release.

Saba Azad welcomes bride with a sweet note after Hrithik Roshan's cousin wedding Saba Azad welcomed Aishwarya Singh into the Roshan family with a heartfelt note as Hrithik Roshan attended cousin Eshaan Roshan's wedding celebrations in Mumbai.

Chella Magale out: Vijay sings soulful father-daughter song in Jana Nayagan Jana Nayagan's third single, Chella Magale, sung by Thalapathy Vijay, beautifully captures the emotional bond between a father and daughter. The heartfelt melody has stirred excitement among fans ahead of the grand Pongal release.

Amaal Mallik clears air on mystery girl: Never been lucky in love Amaal Mallik has revealed that the mystery girl he spoke about on Bigg Boss 19 is no longer in his life, confirming that he is currently single.

Actor Shubhangi Atre denies pay row, explains Bhabhiji Ghar Par Hain exit Shubhangi Atre has opened up about her reasons for departing from the long-running series Bhabhiji Ghar Par Hain. In an interview, she addressed rumours and reflected on personal challenges during her tenure.

Tanya Mittal gives tour of her condom factory, recalls being trolled by Salman Khan After facing criticism on Bigg Boss 18, Tanya Mittal gives a behind-the-scenes look at her Gwalior condom factory, addressing rumours about her business ventures. She also spoke about being trolled by the show's host, Salman Khan.

Salman Khan to share major Battle Of Galwan update on his birthday: Report Salman Khan is set to celebrate his birthday on December 27 by sharing a major update from his upcoming film Battle of Galwan. The reveal, expected to include a key asset from the film, is planned as a special treat for his fans.

Vijay greeted by roaring crowds in Malaysia ahead of Jana Nayagan audio launch Thalapathy Vijay landed in Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia, ahead of the grand audio launch of his much-anticipated film Jana Nayagan, widely believed to be his final outing on the big screen. Videos circulating on X show the actor receiving a thunderous welcome, with fans erupting in cheers as he arrived at his hotel.

Amitabh Bachchan shares his Christmas memory of Calcutta's midnight mass Actor Amitabh Bachchan posted a heartfelt Christmas message, recalling his early experiences attending midnight mass in Calcutta and expressing wishes for peace and happiness to his followers.

Tamil musician GV Prakash sends Rs 20,000 to a fan, internet flags it as scam Composer and actor GV Prakash Kumar transferred Rs 20,000 to a man on social media. Several social media users called it a scam, alleging that the post first appeared in 2022.

Sidharth-Kiara shares Miss Claus glimpse from baby Saraayah's first Christmas Sidharth Malhotra and Kiara Advani celebrated Christmas 2025 with their daughter Saraayah, sharing glimpses of her first Christmas on social media.

Mahesh Babu takes a break from shoots to celebrate cosy Christmas at home Mahesh Babu and Namrata Shirodkar celebrated Christmas with their family and friends. The actor paused his busy filming schedule to join loved ones at home in Hyderabad.

Did you know Leonardo DiCaprio's stepmother is Sikh? Hollywood superstar Leonardo DiCaprio recently opened up about his stepmother being Sikh, surprising many fans. The revelation has sparked widespread interest across India.

Sharmila Tagore recalls Saif and Ness Wadia's school-time antics and PTA meetings Sharmila Tagore shared memories of frequently attending her son Saif Ali Khan's school due to his frequent mischief. The veteran star talked about finding the balance between work and parenthood back then.

Bangladesh lynching: Kajal Aggarwal to Jaya Prada, celebs condemn Dipu Das' killing Indian celebrities demand action and solidarity after the mob lynching of a Hindu factory worker in Bangladesh, raising concerns for minority safety as authorities make arrests and deny blasphemy evidence.

Watch: Thalapathy Vijay holds speaker for Malaysian dancers as they welcome him Thalapathy Vijay was warmly welcomed by Malaysian dancers ahead of the audio launch of his upcoming film, Jana Nayagan. The grand event marks his last event as an actor before entering full-time politics.
Preity Zinta shares cosy family Christmas celebration with husband Gene, twins Preity Zinta shared pictures from her Christmas celebration featuring husband Gene Goodenough and their twin children.

general news.headline: Disrobing Bangladeshi sisters in 1971 shows Pak Army's adharma: Top Army officerCalling the atrocities committed by the Pakistan Army in Bangladesh a "genocide" and "even worse than the Holocaust," Lieutenant General Manoj Kumar Katiyar asked, "The world was a silent spectator. Nobody responded to it. Could we have remained silent in the face of such barbaric happenings in our neighbourhood?"

Ops Sindoor, Mahadev strong message to Pakistan's terrorist masters: Amit ShahAmit Shah said those who planned the terror attack in Pahalgam in April were "punished through Operation Sindoor", while those who executed it were "neutralised through Operation Mahadev".

India alert to Pak threats, can't ignore Islamabad's asymmetric deterrence: TharoorIn an interview with India Today TV's consulting editor Rajdeep Sardesai, Congress MP Shashi Tharoor discussed Pakistan's political and economic situation, China's influence and regional security issues.

Indians will be singled out, attacked: Racist US journo says deport all to save themAmerican journalist and anti-India hate monger, Matt Forney, has asked for all American-Indians to be deported from the US, saying that the community and its temples will see targeted attacks in 2026. In a now-deleted post on X, Forney called for mass deportation of Indian-origin people to save their lives.
Tiny falcons reach Zimbabwe after flying 5,000 km in 5 days from IndiaThree satellite-tagged Amur falcons have completed a record-breaking journey from India to Southern Africa.

CBI challenges Kuldeep Sengar's bail in Supreme Court in Unnao rape caseThe CBI on Friday filed a Special Leave Petition in the Supreme Court after studying the order of the Delhi High Court that granted bail to the expelled BJP MLA Kuldeep Sengar.

India breaks silence on Lalit Modi, Vijay Mallya's 'biggest fugitives' videoThe government's reaction comes days after a video went viral showing Lalit Modi and Vijay Mallya cocking a snook at India and calling themselves 'the biggest fugitives'. Modi and Mallya are in London, and efforts are on to get them extradited.

Video: Israeli reservist rams Palestinian man praying by roadside in West BankThe footage showed the Israeli man driving an all-terrain vehicle into a Palestinian kneeling in prayer on the side of the road.

Will India hand over Sheikh Hasina? History shows even a partridge wasn't betrayedProtecting someone who has sought refuge, even by sacrificing their own life, has been a civilisational ethos of Indians. Those demanding that India hand over Sheikh Hasina should be told how 200 people gave their lives to shield an injured partridge in Gujarat's Muli. From Jam Sataji and Hamir Dev Chauhan to India sheltering the Dalai Lama, this is a dharma that Indians have taken pride in and stayed true to.

DRDO facility, tech park: How politician-builder nexus tried to destroy AravallisAravalli row: A significant portion of the Aravallis falls in Haryana, and over the years, successive governments have tried to hand over large swathes of land to builders and corporates. Here's a look at the instances.

Families facing hardships: India raises H-1B visa delays with USThe Ministry of External Affairs has expressed concern over US visa appointment delays that disrupt citizens' lives, including education, and is in discussions with US officials to resolve the issue.

Udaipur IT firm CEO, female executive, husband offer lift to colleague, rape herUdaipur Police arrested a private firm's CEO, a senior executive and her husband after a female staff alleged gang rape in a moving car, with medical reports and dashcam footage backing complaint.

When some in NDA sought Vajpayee's exit, Mamata stood like a rockSome within the NDA flirted with the idea of moving beyond Atal Bihari Vajpayee and running a government without him after he lost the no-confidence motion in 1999. However, TMC chief Mamata Banerjee and the MDMK's Vaiko made it clear there would be no NDA without Vajpayee at the helm, recalls the ex-PM's media advisor Ashok Tandon.

Google may finally let you change your Gmail address without losing old emailsGoogle is seemingly working on a new feature that will finally allow you to change your Gmail address, but with some restrictions. Here is everything you need to know about how this feature may work.

Canada hospital killed him: Next to Indian-origin man's body, wife narrates ordealStanding beside the body of her husband lying on a bed, she can be seen blaming Grey Nails Hospital for the untimely demise of her husband just at the age of 44 years.

Not Hindustan, Lynchistan: Iltija Mufti after Bengali Muslim man killed in Odisha"Not India or Bharat nor Hindustan. Thy name is Lynchistaan," Mehbooba Mufti's daughter, Iltija, tweeted, along with a picture of the man who was lynched in Odisha amid suspicions that the deceased was an illegal immigrant from Bangladesh.

The 2025 money-makers: Skills that doubled salaries in India within a yearIn 2025, certain skills helped Indian professionals move into much higher salary brackets within a year. From AI and cybersecurity to product and revenue roles, employers paid more for abilities that saved costs, managed risk or drove growth, changing how fast pay could rise.

Chilling video shows attacker shooting AMU teacher multiple times after collapseIn the video, one man can be seen crouching while repeatedly shooting the teacher, aiming at his head, before running away. Around six shots could be heard in the CCTV footage overlooking the AMU library canteen, where the crime took place.

Shafali Verma show powers dominant India Women to T20I series win vs Sri LankaIndia Women thrashed Sri Lanka by eight wickets in Trivandrum, sealing a 3-0 series lead, with Shafali Verma's unbeaten 79 and stellar bowling from Renuka Singh and Deepti Sharma driving the comprehensive win.

Delhi woman says Bengaluru should be India's national capital. Internet reactsA woman from Delhi has sparked a conversation online after sharing her experiences comparing Bengaluru and Delhi, highlighting issues of air quality, safety, and infrastructure.

Kangana Ranaut's winter sarees steal the spotlight in ParliamentDuring the Parliament's Winter Session, Kangana Ranaut balanced warmth with sophistication by layering her sarees with winter essentials like trench coats and sweaters.

India condemns Hindu man's lynching in Bangladesh: Perpetrators must be punishedThe government on Friday condemned the lynching of Hindu men in Bangladesh this month. MEA spokesperson Randhir Jaiswal stressed that those responsible for the attacks must be held accountable.

Cops useless: Canadian journalist warns of anti-Indian sentiment after twin murdersConcerns over the safety of Indians in Canada have intensified after two killings in Toronto within a week. Speaking on the matter, journalist Daniel Bordman blasted the local police and called out their "incompetence," saying, "If you're wondering what the police are doing, they're probably looking into it, but this is Canadian police, so I expect extreme incompetence."

Meet the IIT professor who won national award for his hospital on wheelsIIT Madras Professor Mohanasankar Sivaprakasam has won the Rashtriya Vigyan Puraskar 2025 in the Vigyan Yuva category for his pioneering work in affordable medical devices and brain mapping.

sports.headline: India return close? Shreyas returns to nets, arrives at BCCI CoE before NZ ODIs Shreyas Iyer has stepped up his return to cricket as the India ODI vice-captain started training in the nets and arrived at the BCCI Centre Of Excellence in Bengaluru ahead of the New Zealand series.

World Rapid C'ships: Krishna, Carlsen share early lead, Gukesh makes slow start Fifteen-year-old Goutham Krishna emerged as a surprise joint leader after winning all three games on Day 1, while Indian stars experienced a mixed start in the World Rapid Championships. Krishna leads the way alongside World No.1 Magnus Carlsen.

Unsold in IPL auction, Devon Conway hits 26-ball fifty in SA20 opener Unsold at the IPL 2026 auction, Devon Conway sent a strong reminder of his class with a blazing 26-ball fifty to headline Durban's Super Giants' 232 for 5 against MI Cape Town in the SA20 2025 opener.

Watch: Bus Driver uses Hilarious Technique to record Virat Kohli, video wins Internet The bus driver of the Delhi cricket team is winning hearts as he used a hilarious technique to record Virat Kohli during his time with his state side during the Vijay Hazare Trophy campaign. Kohli played two matches for Delhi in the competition.

Job done: Virat Kohli, Rohit Sharma head home after Vijay Hazare Trophy heroics Indian men's teams megastars Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma lit up the Vijay Hazare Trophy with landmark knocks and fanfare before heading home, now set to return in India's ODI series against New Zealand.

Ashes 2025: Did England set up Bethell for failure at No.3 in Melbourne Test? England's decision to field Jacob Bethell at No.3 in the Melbourne Ashes Test has drawn scrutiny, with the youngster's readiness and recent red-ball experience being questioned by Michael Atherton.

AIFF proposes new structure to save ISL: Own, operate for next 20 seasons AIFF has proposed a new ownership and governance structure for the ISL, with the governing body looking to own the league for the next 20 seasons. AIFF hopes to start the upcoming season from

Shafali Verma show powers dominant India Women to T20I series win vs Sri Lanka India Women thrashed Sri Lanka by eight wickets in Trivandrum, sealing a 3-0 series lead, with Shafali Verma's unbeaten 79 and stellar bowling from Renuka Singh and Deepti Sharma driving the comprehensive win.

Process over noise: Pant's post with Kohli goes viral after Delhi's win vs Gujarat Rishabh Pant posted a set of photos with Virat Kohli and the Delhi team after their thrilling win over Gujarat in the Vijay Hazare Trophy on Friday, December 26. Pant and Kohli's knocks helped Delhi secure the win.

T20 World Cup calling? Najmul Shanto slams statement century to light up BPL Day 1 BPL 2026: Najmul Hossain Shanto announced his T20 comeback in style, scoring an unbeaten 101 to guide Rajshahi Warriors to an eight-wicket win over Sylhet Titans and stake his claim for Bangladesh's T20 World Cup plans.

Wily Deepti Sharma equals world record after sensational spell in 3rd Women's T20I IND vs SL, 3rd T20I: Indian all-rounder Deepti Sharma became the joint-highest wicket-taker in Women's T20Is after she finished with figures of 4-0-18-3 against Sri Lanka on Friday in Trivandrum.

Fair is fair: Pietersen says Australia must be judged like India over Melbourne pitchKevin Pietersen called for Australia to face the same pitch scrutiny as India after 20 wickets fell on Day 1 of the Melbourne Ashes Test, reigniting debate over bowler-friendly surfaces.

Watch: MCG crowd honours late Shane Warne with hat-tipping tribute on Boxing DayThe late Shane Warne was honoured by the MCG crowd on the opening day of the Boxing Day Test, with fans tipping their hats at 3.50pm local time in tribute to his Australian Test cap number, 350.

IND vs SL Highlights, 3rd WT20I: Shafali's unbeaten fifty drives India to victoryIndia Women vs Sri Lanka Women, 3rd T20I Live Score: Shafali Verma puts the stamp on a dominant chase, smashing the winning boundary after a calm single from Harmanpreet Kaur. India cruise home with ease and confidence.

RCB star Devdutt Padikkal continues Bradman-esque run in Vijay Hazare TrophyDevdutt Padikkal's second straight Vijay Hazare century kept Karnataka on course for another win and strengthened his case as one of the tournament's standout batters.

Virat Kohli signs off with Player of the Match awardVirat Kohli reached 1000 runs in the Vijay Hazare Trophy and scored 77 off 61 balls as Delhi beat Gujarat by seven runs on Friday at the Centre of Excellence Ground 1 in Bengaluru.

England greats blame MCG pitch after Ben Stokes's men implode on 20-wicket Day 1AUS vs ENG, 4th Test: England greats Alastair Cook and Stuart Broad slammed the MCG pitch as unfair after 20 wickets fell on a bowler-dominated Day 1 of the Boxing Day Ashes Test.

Magnus Carlsen on facing young rivals like D Gukesh: Don't know how good they may beMagnus Carlsen and D. Gukesh discuss generational shifts and the impact of artificial intelligence in chess ahead of the FIDE World Rapid and Blitz Championship.

Rs. 7 Cr buy Venkatesh Iyer could miss RCB Playing XI? Kumble's explosive takeAnil Kumble said that Venkatesh Iyer won't be a guaranteed starter for RCB despite them buying the Madhya Pradesh all-rounder for Rs. 7 Crore. Iyer is all set for a new chapter with RCB after moving from KKR.

Vidarbha's Dhruv Shorey equals record for most consecutive List A hundredsVidarbha batter Dhruv Shorey scripted his name alongside N Jagadeesan in the List A record books after smashing his fifth consecutive century, an unbeaten 109 off 77 balls, against Hyderabad in the Vijay Hazare Trophy in Rajkot.

Mumbai's Angkrish Raghuvanshi rushed to Jaipur hospital after nasty injuryMumbai batter Angkrish Raghuvanshi was rushed to the hospital after suffering a nasty injury while fielding in the Vijay Hazare Trophy during the Mumbai vs Uttarakhand match.

Rohit bounces back with brilliant slip catch after first-ball duck in JaipurRohit Sharma was dismissed for a golden duck but took a sharp catch at first slip in the Vijay Hazare Trophy fixture against Uttarakhand. Mumbai recovered strongly to post 331/7 as Hardik Tamore top scored with 93*.

Vaibhav Suryavanshi honoured with Pradhan Mantri Rashtriya Bal PuraskarIn this news report, India Today's Nitin Srivastava details the moment 14-year-old cricketer Vaibhav Suryavanshi received the Pradhan Mantri Rashtriya Bal Puraskar from President Droupadi Murmu. The reporter highlights that this prestigious honour comes just days after the 'explosive young batter' smashed a record-breaking 190 runs for Bihar in domestic cricket. Srivastava notes that Vaibhav has 'captured the nation's attention' not only with his batting style but also by earning India's highest civilian honour for children. The segment positions him as a future icon of Indian cricket.

Babar Azam endures yet another failure on Boxing Day at Big Bash LeagueBabar Azam's struggles in the Big Bash League continued on Boxing Day as the Pakistan star fell for 2 again, recording his third single-digit score in four matches for the Sydney Sixers.

Rajesh Mohanty becomes 1st Odisha bowler to take List A hat-trickOdisha fast bowler Rajesh Mohanty delivered a historic performance, becoming the first player from the state to claim a List A hat-trick. His early strikes set the tone for a dominant Odisha display, restricting Services to 83.

Australia's Michael Neser savours 'dream come true' Boxing Day masterclassMichael Neser starred with both bat and ball in his long-awaited Boxing Day Ashes debut at the MCG, leading Australia to a 46-run first-innings lead after a dramatic day that saw 20 wickets fall.

T20 World Cup-bound Rinku Singh signals rich form with quickfire 106 for UPRinku Singh stayed in strong form in the Vijay Hazare Trophy, scoring an unbeaten 106 for Uttar Pradesh and building momentum ahead of India's upcoming T20I series against New Zealand.

20 wickets tumble on Boxing Day as England's Ashes horror continues Ashes 2025–26: England's batters failed to build on the good work done by their bowlers as 20 wickets fell in a single day for the first time in 124 years in the Ashes. The visitors ended the opening day on the back foot at the Melbourne Cricket Ground.

Manchester City owners explain decision to cut ties with Mumbai FC amid ISL fiascoCity Football Group, which owns several top clubs worldwide, including English Premier League giants Manchester City, has explained its decision to pull out of its association with Mumbai City FC amid uncertainty over the future of the Indian Super League.

Vijay Hazare Trophy: Pant's sublime 70 guides Delhi to 254 against GujaratRishabh Pant played a brilliant innings, scoring 70 as Delhi posted 254 against Gujarat in the Vijay Hazare Trophy. Vishal Jayswal's four-wicket haul troubled Delhi batters.

Dhurandhar in Ashes? Fans joke Ben Stokes, Brendon McCullum are New Zealand spiesAshes 2025-26: Ben Stokes and Brendon McCullum are being humorously labelled as New Zealand spies amid England's poor Ashes performance. The viral memes highlight fan frustration and raise questions about England's preparation and conduct during the series.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
